caption: Each and every selection was made with sincere commitment and talent. You can literally taste their effort and the immersion of experience is outstanding.

As part of Cocoron team, they claim themselves the first Shabu Shabu Omakase in the world. The set includes 4 appetizers, 14 ways/flavors of Shabu Shabu, a bowl of soba and dessert for $150 per person.  There are only 2 time slots available from Tue to Sunday and they serve only 2 groups (5 people maximum) each slot. The reservation should be made on Yelp with credit card.  The chef and the staff were friendly and sweet. It was an amazing dining experience and all the food was prepared in one bite size so customers can eat easily and elegantly.  The food was delicious with no doubt, especially the quality of Wagyu Beef. All flavors were delicate and various from sweet, sour to spicy. The arrangement of each dish is reasonable and balanced. Our favorite was the Sukiyaki, which was perfect with a pouch egg & sauce.

Nice Dinning Experience! Very kind service and decorative dish presentation. It is enjoyable to watch chief present the dish. Creative dish design. Note that it’s a little bit pricey, but exchanged for a same value experience.  Majority shabu shabu dish present with beef. Chief’s home made sauces is also an inspiration point. Really love the soybean curd with uni. Home made soba noodle was not the noodle texture I expected, but serve with really good broth.  I got super full by the end.  p.s. Really love all their dinnerware especially huge tea cups 🥰

I had the most amazing dinner here. Each bite was very memorable. The waygu literally explodes and melts in your mouth. Each bite was mouth watering and there was a good use to veggies to break up the textures and complement and pace the whole meal. The different sauces were so creative as well. Loved it. Very memorable and want to take others to try it.

Had a wonderful meal here this past  Sunday night after a winter storm.   Since it was private dinning and the seating before ours had cancelled, it ended up like the restaurant opened just for us.  Chef Mayumon was very nice and friendly.   The A5 Wagyu from Miyazaki was melt in your mouth tender, and perfectly cooked.  The washugyu had more beefy flavours which is great as well.  (Personally, I prefer washugyu.).   Each bite was cooked with care, and the sauces all paired very well with the different bites.  The chef was very attentive.which made the meal even more enjoyable.  Overall, it was a great experience, and we will definitely visit again
Delicious dinner of high quality meat, super nice staff

Amazing experiences with the Omakase styled Wagyu Shabu-shabu, definitely one of the most memorable and unique experiences we've had. The wagyu simply melted in your mouth and it was surprising how the different sauces make each bite become so unique! The flow was so well, with a good pace and a perfect combination of meat and veggies. You have to experience it yourself and you will understand what we mean! The restaurant has a limited capacity during covid with a very pleasant setting!

The food was out of this world and the sake was smooth and tasteful. The meat was perfect, melts in your mouth and the sauces each meat was paired with were so unique! Great service, very friendly. The prepared menu was flawless! Definitely recommend!
Wonderful experience. Well spaced and clean. The food and the experience was something to remember. I would definitely book a nother reservation to this place in the near future.
Great food a highly recommended location hopefully all reopen soon
An amazing shabu shabu experience!
Delicious food and intimate experience. Leave very full
A truly special and unique dining experience. Wonderful service and delicious food. Each bite perfectly constructed. You will leave very full!
The food was fantastic, just like Shabu Shabu Macoron.  Everything was delicious!  It's pricey, but well worth it in my opinion.  I'll have to go back after Covid to try it when it's completely open.
A regular.  Definitely on the list

Heartily recommended for both meetings and friends as well for having an excellent atmosphere. This restaurant got good music selection and delicious foods. Trust me! You will never be disappointed for sure! I am deeply impressed by how they handled the service correctly with no hassles at all. I will surely come back! NICE!

This is the best place where you can have different meals with all your loved ones. They all have the best meals for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Based on our experience, we all loved the food we ordered for it was all served hot and tasty. We got home full and happy. Just check out their other menus online. Must try!
We were worried this would be a gimmick, but the food greatly exceeded expectations!
New style of shabu-shabu, love the experience.
Very satisfying meat eating experience. Excellent cooking skill. The chef noticed my low tolerance of wasabi from the appetizer and asked me how much I want every time afterwards.

Incredible food, friendly and warm yet sophisticated service by Mayu and her trained staff! Simple yet deep flavored Mushroom, Yuba uni appetizer are outstanding, A5 wagyu beef and washu gyu are extremely silky and juicy, especially A5 Miyazaki hand roll is just awesome... Even I have never experienced this Shabushabu OMAKASE style in Japan, everyone should have this amazing experience. Highly recommended!
My thing is Sushi! I was in NY for my wedding and stopped into Shabushabu Mayumon as I heard great things. 5 stars! Must try the Shabu Shabu!! Cant wait to be back in New York to visit again
friendly, warm, delicious food.   it's the best meal you can have when it's cold outside.
Really unique experience to have Shabu Shabu cooked and served with the extraordinary care normally reserved for other Japanese cuisines like sushi.

Yummmm! This place is simply delightful in terms of the food experience. The meat bites are damn delicious. However at its price point, I would have expected to be a bit more full after all the courses.

During my trip last weekend in New York City. I found an fantastic place called shabushabu Mayumon which was opened last month. This is the first time I heard about the idea of shabushabu omakase. The food is absolutely outstanding. It is fun, delicious and full of concept. I can see chef Mayu and her team’s efforts behind the menu. This is the future of the restaurant.

Incredible experience with incredible food at the sister restaurant to Shabu Shabu Macoron. I went on a Tuesday for dinner and found at I was the only one who reserved for the day as Tuesdays were slow days for the place, so I had the full attention of Chef Mayu throughout the delicious Shabu Shabu course. To clarify, Macoron's omakase trends more towards Japanese style and flavors, while Mayumon features a larger focus on the taste of meat and fusion flavors.  First off, the venue has a long bar-table area upon  which food is served, brightly lit enough to accentuate the classy atmosphere and complimented by decidedly jazzy background music. Chef Mayu was friendly and receptive to both welcome me and answer any questions I has about the course/ingredients, doing both the cooking and serving of drinks herself.  Then comes the food, which as mentioned before, was nothing short of uniquely spectacular. The tasting menu features a curious mix of western inspired Japanese dishes executed to great effect, with the bagna cauda appetizer standing out to me for its rich umami flavor balanced out by the bright and juicy vegetables to dip into it.  The meats themselves were a good mix of highly marbled A4 Miyazaki beef, pork belly and flavorful Washugyu beef, with the choice of A4 being a purposeful choice as A5's fat content would not translate optimally to Mayu's unique Shabu Shabu preparation and accompanying sauces. I in particular was surprised by the use of blue cheese, basil sauce, fig sauce and balsamic vinegar on one of the beef pieces, as it was a combination of cultures and flavors that I was not expecting, but was delighted to find worked perfectly together. As I was the sole patron for the night, the whole course took just under an hour or so to complete, with the pacing of the meal coming at just the right intervals to allows for proper consumption and appreciation of the food without feeling too rushed or neglected. Props to Chef Mayu for that.  Overall, the ~128usd sans tax tasting menu was more than enough food for me to leave feeling full and satisfied. Of note is that Chef Mayu told me that sometimes people get too full towards the end of the course that they forego the soba noodles and kakigori shaved ice, so there's no need to worry about not leaving satiated. I'm definitely planning to come again and bring others along with me as Chef Mayu is thinking about changing up the menu since the restaurnts launch in May of 2019, and wholeheartedly recommend this place to anyone looking to venture out of the ever popular sushi omakase and try out something new.

Wow! What an amazing experience! Every bite is well thought out and delicious. Only the absolute highest quality ingredients are used here. I loved the special service and attention given, which adds a lot to the experience. Thank you for such a lovely evening!

Mayu takes shabu to a higher station with her innovative approach on flavor; authentically Japanese, there are still moments you dont feel far from the Mediterranean.  Get in before the Times does, you’ll leave happy and hopefully buzzed from the great sake...
